title: Oceanfront Home on the Hawaiian Island of Maui Sells for $42 Million; The property was sold by Silicon Valley venture capitalist Pierre Lamond
text:
The sale is the latest in a series of $40 million-plus deals in Hawaii, where the luxury market took off during the pandemic.

The property was sold off-market by Nancy Callahan of the Wailea Group, who said the sellers used the home as a holiday retreat. As for why they sold, she said, "they had it for 30 years. They were ready to let it go." The couple also own a home in Atherton, Calif., records show. David Richardson of the brokerage Hawaii Life represented the buyer, who he declined to name. The Lamonds didn't immediately respond to a request for comment.

In Hawaii, the Lamonds purchased the first parcel, on roughly half an acre, for $1.5 million in 1989, records show. Ms. Callahan said the couple built a roughly 4,000-square-foot house on the parcel. In 2008, they paid $10 million for an adjacent house, records show.

Mr. Richardson said his buyer got a "wholesale price" for purchasing the two parcels together, but doesn't need two houses and may sell one of them. "Right now, there's hardly any product on the market," he said.

Since July, two other recorded sales in Hawaii have topped $40 million. On Maui, San Francisco investment banker Thomas Weisel sold an oceanfront mansion for $45 million in July. On the Big Island, the estate of late Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen sold for $43 million.

Oceanfront Home on the Hawaiian Island of Maui Sells for $42 Million
